title: Bi-Weekly Food and Recipes Thread
selftext:
Foodies of r/India! Tried out a new dish? Experimented with cooking yourself and lived to tell the story? Share here!

Feel free to share recipes, and if you tried out something new, you can also share pictures!

**The Food Thread is posted every two weeks on Friday mornings.**

https://preview.redd.it/tti3fyiqw8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&s=899972afbc4bab665798a0f5917960a98ec4f4d5
comments:
Hello to you nice folks,

क्या आप भी अच्छे व्यंजन खाना पसंद करते हैं लेकिन ऐसा करते समय वजन नहीं बढ़ाना चाहते हैं?

फिर मैं आपके लिए बहुत कम कैलोरी सामग्री के साथ एक शानदार भोजन लाया हूँ

Diet coke Brownies :

125-150 ml Diet coke or any zero Diet soda that is sweet

30 Grams of Cocoa powder

20 Grams Flour (Ata or Maida, whatever you wish)

Baking powder and salt (I add 8-10 sugarfree natura pellets, the sucrolose one, not the aspartame one,  i like it a bit more sweeter but that is optional)

&#x200B;

Mix that shit in a blender for properly mixing it, set the oven to max and bake that stuff like any regular cake or bread.

&#x200B;

Calories? only 190 calories for a huge ass cake sized chocolate Brownie. Actually tastes very very very good
Ok fellas, I am gonna try my hand at cooking biryani this eid. Any basmati rice brand you recommend and any recipe?

Last week I followed the Ranveer Brar's biryani recipe and it came out to be really good. Also it is very easy to make, just make sure you don't overcook the rice, it cooks very fast. I used the India gate dubar basmati rice.

I don't have any recipe but this biryani masala I ordered from Amazon is really good! Link:
https://www.amazon.in/dp/B00ZQZY9GK/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_apa_glt_fabc_8ABVAKCMZHCKC1JK3D2J?_encoding=UTF8&psc=1
हमको ये शंदर भंजन न मांगता भीडू
Ok. Gonna give this a try. Have you just tried the Lucknowi one or also the Hyderabadi one? I wish it was possible to get one of each.
Yeah I have tried both. Both are good but I personally prefer Lucknowi. Hyderabadi was bit more salty.
Watched the video, gathering all the ingredients might be a bit of problem but lets try. And I didn't know people add that milk mixture to biryani.
